pages.text: Elemental soil is all that is required in order to grow either of the four elemental plants: $(l:herbs/infernal_bulb)infernal bulb$(), $(l:herbs/dewgonia)dewgonia$(), $(l:herbs/stalicripe)stalicripe$() and $(l:herbs/cloud_berry)cloud berry$().$(br2)$(info) This soil can also grow almost any other crop, giving them all a growth boost.$(br2)There are also variants of elemental soil aligned with each of the four elements, with special crafting methods.

Caelic soil is produced when elemental soil is thrown onto the ground above the height of $(config:air_min_y), where, after $(config:air_delay) seconds, the proximity to the sky will convert it.$(br2)$(info) It accelerates the growth of anything planted upon.

Terran soil is produced by throwing elemental soil onto the floor of an underground cave (at least below the height of $(config:earth_max_y)). After $(config:earth_delay) seconds absorbing the depths, the soil can be collected.$(br2)$(info) Terran soil is exceedingly fertile, occasionally causing plants to produce additional drops.

Aqueous soil is produced by submerging elemental soil in water for at least $(config:water_delay) seconds. Once thoroughly soaked, the imbued soil can be collected.$(br2)$(info) Aqueous soil automatically harvests any plant grown on it, unless gravel is placed directly below the soil.

Magmatic soil is produced by throwing elemental soil directly into lava. The harsh flames will immediately convert the soil and return it for collection.$(br2)$(info) Magmatic soil automatically cooks a portion of the drops of all plants grown upon it, occasionally granting experience for harvesting.
